revisionDesc.change: Finalized - Ready. There is no diaeresis on the first iota of Ἰσιδωρος in lin13 (checked against the image). Image also verifies the observation of van der Laan on lin26 where the papyrus has ἐνγ(υητὴς).
Add dummy header for original identifier 'papyri.info/ddbdp/p.cair.preis;;20' pointing to new identifier 'papyri.info/ddbdp/p.cair.preis.2;;20'

Submit - Entered Greek text from P.Cair.Preis. (2) 20. General remark: the whole text through ἐνγυητής is regularized into ἐγγυητής, in various forms of abbreviation. I would prefer to encode this from lin4 on by "passim" in stead of line for line repetition of the message, but don't know how to do. lin3: changed Πόλεως into πόλεως according to policy that only geo- and topographical names are written with capital (or is Πόλις an official alternative of Ἑρμόπολις?); lin13: Ἰσιδωρος without diaeresis (forgotten by editor?). lin26: this is only example of ἐγγ instead of ἐνγ: must be typo, see also editors commentary on this line. Therefore I would prefer also lin25 <:<ἐγγυητὴς>|reg|<ἐνγυητὴς>:> instead of editors inserted <ἐγγυητὴς>
Automated transfer of accents across reg-orig pairs
batch converted all tei:sic to tei:orig and tei:corr to tei:reg
changed schema; added xml:space=preserve; indented; moved title/@n to idno
Converted from TEI P4 (EpiDoc DTD v. 6) to P5 (EpiDoc RNG schema)
